Home → News → Page → News

News

Suffolk Libraries is now a National Portfolio Organisation

Written by James Powell · Published Apr 6, 2018

As of 1 April 2018, we have official National Portfolio Status from the Arts Council.

Good news for Kesgrave Library

Written by James Powell · Published Mar 26, 2018

Everyone at Suffolk Libraries would like to congratulate Maggie Lusher, manager of Kesgrave Library, who was the winner of the Services to the Community award at the recent Suffolk Coastal Business and Community Awards.

New children's book selection available at Ipswich Jobcentre

Written by James Powell · Published Mar 26, 2018

Any parents or carers visiting Ipswich Jobcentre with their children can now enjoy a small selection of children’s books thanks to a donation from Suffolk Libraries.

Felixstowe Library to launch new friends group

Written by James Powell · Published Mar 22, 2018

The newly formed Friends of Felixstowe Library will be officially launched on Saturday 7 April, with help from BBC Radio Suffolk presenter Lesley Dolphin and Mayor of Felixstowe Nick Barber.

New Suffolk Libraries Local session launches in Rushmere

Written by James Powell · Published Mar 19, 2018

A new Suffolk Libraries Local session in Rushmere launched at Ransomes Sports Pavilion on 14 March.

Sporting legends to help launch Sporting Memories groups

Written by James Powell · Published Feb 1, 2018

Two Ipswich Town legends and a former Olympian will be helping to launch our new Sporting Memories groups at Ipswich County Library on Tuesday 6 February at 2pm.

Read Easy Ipswich launches to help adults who struggle with reading

Written by James Powell · Published Jan 30, 2018

Adult literacy in Ipswich is set to get a boost as a national initiative arrives in the town at the end of January.

Ipswich schools sign up to Reading Pledge

Written by James Powell · Published Jan 4, 2018

The first schools in Ipswich have signed up to a reading pledge as part of the ‘Let’s Talk Reading’ project which is working to improve reading skills across the town.

Suffolk Libraries chief executive recognised in New Year's Honours list

Written by James Powell · Published Dec 30, 2017

Suffolk Libraries chief executive Alison Wheeler has been awarded an MBE in the New Year’s Honours List 2018.

Join the squad with our new Sporting Memories groups

Written by James Powell · Published Dec 29, 2017

We're teaming up with the Sporting Memories Network to host Sporting Memories reminiscence groups at six of our libraries.
